Article/0-0-0-18/server-functions.html:
Server functions are specialized microservices that at transpile time are converted into API entry points.<\/p>

To flag a function as a server function, you must declare it as static async<\/code>.<\/p>

Being a static function means it has no access to the instance scope.<\/p>

However, instead of calling the static version from the class<\/em>, you must invoke it as an instance<\/em> function.<\/p>

Server functions can be called anytime in your code and are not limited to prerender<\/a> steps.<\/p> 

import<\/span> Nullstack from<\/span> 'nullstack'<\/span>;<\/span>

class<\/span> Component<\/span> extends<\/span> Nullstack<\/span> {<\/span>

  static<\/span> async<\/span> increment<\/span>(<\/span>context<\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    context.<\/span>count++<\/span>;<\/span>
  }<\/span>

  async<\/span> handleClick<\/span>(<\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    await<\/span> this<\/span>.<\/span>increment<\/span>(<\/span>)<\/span>;<\/span>
  }<\/span>

  // ...<\/span>

}<\/span>

export<\/span> default<\/span> Component;<\/span>
<\/code><\/pre>

You can also call static methods directly which is useful for some code patterns that invoke external server functions.<\/p>

import<\/span> Nullstack from<\/span> 'nullstack'<\/span>;<\/span>
import<\/span> UserStore from<\/span> './UserStore'<\/span>;<\/span>

class<\/span> Component<\/span> extends<\/span> Nullstack<\/span> {<\/span>

  async<\/span> initiate<\/span>(<\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    this<\/span>.<\/span>users =<\/span> await<\/span> UserStore.<\/span>getAllUsers<\/span>(<\/span>)<\/span>
  }<\/span>

  // ...<\/span>

}<\/span>

export<\/span> default<\/span> Component;<\/span>
<\/code><\/pre>



âœ¨ Learn more about the server context<\/a>.<\/p>
<\/blockquote>

Client behavior<\/a><\/h2>
When you call a server function from the client, the arguments will be serialized as JSON.<\/p>

The arguments will be posted against the automatically generated API and merged with the server context when it reaches the server.<\/p>

The return value of the server function will be serialized back to the client and can be seamlessly used as if it were a local function.<\/p>

import<\/span> Nullstack from<\/span> 'nullstack'<\/span>;<\/span>

class<\/span> Component<\/span> extends<\/span> Nullstack<\/span> {<\/span>

  static<\/span> async<\/span> increment<\/span>(<\/span>context<\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    context.<\/span>count++<\/span>;<\/span>
    return<\/span> context.<\/span>count;<\/span>
  }<\/span>

  async<\/span> handleClick<\/span>(<\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    this<\/span>.<\/span>count =<\/span> await<\/span> this<\/span>.<\/span>increment<\/span>(<\/span>)<\/span>;<\/span>
  }<\/span>

  // ...<\/span>

}<\/span>

export<\/span> default<\/span> Component;<\/span>
<\/code><\/pre>

Server behavior<\/a><\/h2>
Server functions will be used as local functions, simply aliasing the instance<\/em> call to the class<\/em> and merging the arguments with the server context.<\/p>

Date Convenience<\/a><\/h2>
Dates are serialized as UTC in JSON and deserialized back to Date<\/code> objects.<\/p>

import<\/span> Nullstack from<\/span> 'nullstack'<\/span>;<\/span>

class<\/span> Component<\/span> extends<\/span> Nullstack<\/span> {<\/span>

  async<\/span> initiate<\/span>(<\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    const<\/span> date =<\/span> new<\/span> Date<\/span>(<\/span>)<\/span>;<\/span>
    const<\/span> verified =<\/span> this<\/span>.<\/span>verifyDay<\/span>(<\/span>{<\/span>date}<\/span>)<\/span>;<\/span>
  }<\/span>

  static<\/span> async<\/span> verifyDay<\/span>(<\/span>{<\/span>date}<\/span><\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    return<\/span> date.<\/span>getDay<\/span>(<\/span>)<\/span> ===<\/span> new<\/span> Date<\/span>(<\/span>)<\/span>.<\/span>getDay<\/span>(<\/span>)<\/span>;<\/span>
  }<\/span>

  // ...<\/span>

}<\/span>

export<\/span> default<\/span> Component;<\/span>
<\/code><\/pre>

Fetch Convenience<\/a><\/h2>
fetch<\/code> is available in both server and client functions for the sake of isomorphy.<\/p>

import<\/span> Nullstack from<\/span> 'nullstack'<\/span>;<\/span>

class<\/span> Component<\/span> extends<\/span> Nullstack<\/span> {<\/span>

  // ...<\/span>

  async<\/span> initiate<\/span>(<\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    const<\/span> url =<\/span> 'https://api.github.com/repos/nullstack/nullstack/issues'<\/span>;<\/span>
    const<\/span> response =<\/span> await<\/span> fetch<\/span>(<\/span>url)<\/span>;<\/span>
    this<\/span>.<\/span>issues =<\/span> await<\/span> response.<\/span>json<\/span>(<\/span>)<\/span>;<\/span>
  }<\/span>

  // ...<\/span>

}<\/span>

export<\/span> default<\/span> Component;<\/span>
<\/code><\/pre>

Server only imports<\/a><\/h2>
Imported dependencies that are only used inside server functions will be excluded from the client bundle.<\/p>

This is useful for both accessing node.js exclusive modules and reducing the client bundle size by preprocessing data like markdown without having to expose the dependency to the end-user.<\/p>

import<\/span> Nullstack from<\/span> 'nullstack'<\/span>;<\/span>
import<\/span> {<\/span>readFileSync}<\/span> from<\/span> 'fs'<\/span>;<\/span>
import<\/span> {<\/span>Remarkable}<\/span> from<\/span> 'remarkable'<\/span>;<\/span>

class<\/span> Application<\/span> extends<\/span> Nullstack<\/span> {<\/span>

  static<\/span> async<\/span> getTasks<\/span>(<\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    const<\/span> readme =<\/span> readFileSync<\/span>(<\/span>'README.md'<\/span>,<\/span> 'utf-8'<\/span>)<\/span>;<\/span>
    return<\/span> new<\/span> Remarkable<\/span>(<\/span>)<\/span>.<\/span>render<\/span>(<\/span>readme)<\/span>;<\/span>
  }<\/span>

  // ...<\/span>

}<\/span>

export<\/span> default<\/span> Application;<\/span>
<\/code><\/pre>

Security<\/a><\/h2>
Keep in mind that every server function is similar to an Express route in API and must be coded without depending on view logic for security.<\/p>

import<\/span> Nullstack from<\/span> 'nullstack'<\/span>;<\/span>

class<\/span> Component<\/span> extends<\/span> Nullstack<\/span> {<\/span>

  static<\/span> async<\/span> getCount<\/span>(<\/span>{<\/span>request,<\/span> count}<\/span><\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    if<\/span>(<\/span>!<\/span>request.<\/span>session.<\/span>user)<\/span> return<\/span> 0<\/span>;<\/span>
    return<\/span> count;<\/span>
  }<\/span>

  // ...<\/span>

}<\/span>

export<\/span> default<\/span> Component;<\/span>
<\/code><\/pre>

Server functions with the name starting with "_" do not generate an API endpoint and do not have access to the context by default to avoid malicious API calls.<\/p>

import<\/span> Nullstack from<\/span> 'nullstack'<\/span>;<\/span>

class<\/span> Component<\/span> extends<\/span> Nullstack<\/span> {<\/span>

  static<\/span> async<\/span> _getCount<\/span>(<\/span>{<\/span> request }<\/span><\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    return<\/span> request.<\/span>count;<\/span>
  }<\/span>

  static<\/span> async<\/span> getDoubleCount<\/span>(<\/span>{<\/span> request }<\/span><\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    if<\/span>(<\/span>!<\/span>request.<\/span>session.<\/span>user)<\/span> return<\/span> 0<\/span>;<\/span>
    return<\/span> this<\/span>.<\/span>_getCount<\/span>(<\/span>{<\/span> request }<\/span>)<\/span> *<\/span> this<\/span>.<\/span>_getCount<\/span>(<\/span>{<\/span> request }<\/span>)<\/span>;<\/span>
  }<\/span>

  // ...<\/span>

}<\/span>

export<\/span> default<\/span> Component;<\/span>
<\/code><\/pre>



ðŸ’¡ Server functions are not exposed to the client.<\/p>
<\/blockquote>



âœ¨ Learn more about the jsx elements<\/a>.<\/p>
<\/blockquote>

Reserved words<\/a><\/h2>
Server function names cannot collide with instance method names from the current class or its parent classes.<\/p>

The following words cannot be used in server functions:<\/p>

    

  • prepare<\/code><\/li>

  • initiate<\/code><\/li>

  • launch<\/code><\/li>

  • hydrate<\/code><\/li>

  • update<\/code><\/li>

  • terminate<\/code><\/li>
<\/ul>

    Server functions named start<\/code> will not generate an API endpoint and can only be called by other server functions.<\/p>

    Reserved HTTP method prefixes<\/a><\/h2>
    Server functions declared with their names starting with HTTP verbs will be executed accordingly to the respective HTTP method.
Supported verbs are:<\/p>

      

    • get<\/code><\/li>

    • post<\/code><\/li>

    • put<\/code><\/li>

    • patch<\/code><\/li>

    • delete<\/code><\/li>
<\/ul>

      import<\/span> Nullstack from<\/span> "nullstack"<\/span>;<\/span>

class<\/span> HTTPVerbs<\/span> extends<\/span> Nullstack<\/span> {<\/span>
  // this is a GET request<\/span>
  static<\/span> async<\/span> getUserById<\/span>(<\/span>{<\/span> id }<\/span><\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    // ...<\/span>
  }<\/span>

  // this is a POST request<\/span>
  static<\/span> async<\/span> postUser<\/span>(<\/span>{<\/span> data }<\/span><\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    // ...<\/span>
  }<\/span>

  // this is a PUT request<\/span>
  static<\/span> async<\/span> putUserById<\/span>(<\/span>{<\/span> id,<\/span> data }<\/span><\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    // ...<\/span>
  }<\/span>

  // this is a PATCH request<\/span>
  static<\/span> async<\/span> patchUserById<\/span>(<\/span>{<\/span> id,<\/span> data }<\/span><\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    // ...<\/span>
  }<\/span>

  // this is a DELETE request<\/span>
  static<\/span> async<\/span> deleteUserById<\/span>(<\/span>{<\/span> id }<\/span><\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    // ...<\/span>
  }<\/span>

  // ...<\/span>
}<\/span>

export<\/span> default<\/span> HTTPVerbs;<\/span>
<\/code><\/pre>

      

      ðŸ’¡ Server functions without those special prefixes will be defaulted to a POST request.<\/p>
<\/blockquote>

      

      ðŸ”¥ Be mindful to the specification of each HTTP method. For example, GET requests have a limit of 2kb of data that can be passed as a parameter, so attempting to send an entire object to a server function may result in failure.<\/p>
<\/blockquote>

      Performance Considerations<\/a><\/h2>
      Server functions are just API endpoints in the end of the day. Be mindful of this when making function calls, and try to keep the payload as small as possible.<\/p>

      import<\/span> Nullstack from<\/span> 'nullstack'<\/span>;<\/span>

class<\/span> Component<\/span> extends<\/span> Nullstack<\/span> {<\/span>

  // âœ… do this <\/span>
  static<\/span> async<\/span> getUserProfileById<\/span>(<\/span>{<\/span> id }<\/span><\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    // ...<\/span>
  }<\/span>

  async<\/span> hydrate<\/span>(<\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    this<\/span>.<\/span>profile =<\/span> await<\/span> this<\/span>.<\/span>getUserProfileById<\/span>(<\/span>{<\/span>id<\/span>:<\/span> this<\/span>.<\/span>user.<\/span>id}<\/span>)<\/span>
  }<\/span>

  // ðŸš« do not do this <\/span>
  static<\/span> async<\/span> getUserProfile<\/span>(<\/span>{<\/span> user }<\/span><\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    const<\/span> id =<\/span> user.<\/span>id
    // ...<\/span>
  }<\/span>

  async<\/span> hydrate<\/span>(<\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    this<\/span>.<\/span>profile =<\/span> await<\/span> this<\/span>.<\/span>getUserProfile<\/span>(<\/span>{<\/span>user<\/span>:<\/span> this<\/span>.<\/span>user}<\/span>)<\/span>
  }<\/span>

  // ...<\/span>

}<\/span>

export<\/span> default<\/span> Component;<\/span>
<\/code><\/pre>

      Caveats<\/a><\/h2>
      Automatically generated API endpoints are not meant to be used by 3rd-party apps.<\/p>

      The URL and implementation may change between versions of Nullstack.<\/p>

      Server functions endpoints are based on file path and function name, changing those might cause backwards compatibility problems in some scenarios.<\/p>

      

      âœ¨ If you want to build an API, learn more about how to create an API with Nullstack<\/a>.<\/p>
